question: I have been diagnosed with hypertension for several years and have been taking atenelol, nifediac cc, along with vytorin to control my cholesterol.  My BP was usually in the range of 120-130 / 85-90.  I was recently diagnosed with  borderline type 2 diabetes, so my doctor has prescribed actiplus met.  Because of the diabetes, my doctor took me off the atenelol and nifediac and started me on avodart.  My blood pressure immediately shot up to 150-170 / 100-115.  To help control the BP she started me back on the nifediac.  Since starting the back on the nifediac less than a week ago I started having wild swings in BP.  Morning starts off in range of 120-140 / 90-100 and by afternoon it drops to 100-110 / 65-75.  In the evening it starts to goes back up to the morning range.  My heartrate was stabilized at around 70-80 before initiall dropping the atenelol and nifediac cc, but since starting back on the nifediac, my heart rate is constatly high in the 100-120 range.  Has anyone heard of or know why the wild swings in BP and HR?
title: Swings In Blood Pressure
